title: Washington Commanders Deny Allegations of Financial Wrongdoing to FTC
sub_head: The powerful House committee investigating the team wrote last week that the club and top executives may have engaged in a ‘long-running, and potentially unlawful pattern of financial conduct’
body:
WASHINGTON—The Washington Commanders denied allegations of financial misconduct and assailed the powerful House committee investigating the team in the NFL franchise’s first formal response to the accusations put in front of federal regulators.
Allegations of financial malfeasance inside the Commanders were detailed last week in a letter from the House Committee on Oversight and Reform to the Federal Trade Commission. The letter suggested that top executives for the club, including owner Dan Snyder, had engaged in a “long-running, and potentially unlawful pattern of financial conduct.”
